title.narrative: Papua New Guinea COVID-19 Emergency Response Project

description.narrative: To prevent, detect and respond to the threat posed by COVID-19 and strengthen national systems for public health preparedness in Papua New Guinea (PNG).

condition.narrative: By not later than two months after the Effective Date, the Recipient shall prepare and adopt an updated Project Operations Manual,which shall include the roles of NCC and communications between agencies involved in the COVID-19 response, in form and substancesatisfactory to the Association, and thereafter ensure that the Project is carried out in accordance with the Project OperationsManual. (Section I.B of Schedule 2 to the Financing Agreement)**

Ensure Project is carried out in accorance with the Environmental and Social Standards (Section 1 D.1 of Schedule 2), andimplemented in accordance with the ESCP: (a) measures and actions specified in the ESCP are implemented with due diligence andefficiency; (b) sufficient funds are available to cover implementation costs; (c) policies and procedures are maintained andqualified and experienced staff are retained to implement the ESCP; and (d) the ESCP or any provision is not amended, repealed,suspended or waived, except as the Association shall agree in writing as specified in the ESCP and revised ESCP is disclosedpromptly thereafter (Section I D.2 of Schedule 2).*

Ensure all measures necessary are taken to collect, compile, and furnish through regular reports, with the frequency specified inthe ESCP and promptly in a separate report(s) if requested by the Association, information on status of compliance with the ESCPand referred to instruments (Section I D.4 of Schedule 2).*
Establish, publicize, maintain and operate an accessible grievance mechanism to receive and facilitate resolution of concerns andgrievances (Section I D.5 of Schedule 2)*

In order to ensure adequate implementation of Part 1.4(b) of the Project, the Recipient shall prepare and adopt a Vaccine Deliveryand Distribution Manual, in form and substance satisfactory to the Association, and thereafter carry out Part 1.4(b) of the Projectin accordance with the Financing Agreement, the Project Operations Manual and the Vaccine Delivery and Distribution Manual.(Section I.C of Schedule 2 to the Financing Agreement)

Section I.D.6 added to Schedule 2 of the Original Financing Agreement, as incorporated and applied to the Financing Agreementpursuant to Section I.A.1 of Schedule 2 to the Financing Agreement:“Should there be any use of security personnel for provision ofsecurity to Project workers, sites and/or assets, the Recipient, through its National Department of Health, shall take thefollowing measures related to the use of security personnel for provision of security to Project workers, sites and/or assets, in amanner satisfactory to the Association: (a) adopt and enforce standards, protocols and codes of conduct for the selection and useof security personnel, and screen such personnel to verify that they have not engaged in past unlawful or abusive behavior,including sexual exploitation and abuse, sexual harassment or excessive use of force; (b) ensure that such personnel is deployed inaccordance with the relevant requirements of ESSs and the ESCP; (c) ensure that such personnel is adequately instructed andtrained, prior to deployment and on a regular basis, on the use of force and appropriate conduct (including in relation tocivilian-security engagement, sexual exploitation and abuse and sexual harassment, and other relevant areas), as set out in theEnvironmental and Social Management Framework; (d) ensure that the stakeholder engagement activities under the StakeholderEngagement Plan include a communication strategy on the involvement of security personnel under the Project; and (e) ensure thatany concerns or grievances regarding the conduct of such personnel are received, monitored, documented (taking into account theneed to protect confidentiality), resolved through the Project’s grievance mechanism; and reported to the Association no later thanfourteen (14) days after being received.”*

Section I.F.1 added to Schedule 2 of the Original Financing Agreement, as incorporated and applied to the Financing Agreementpursuant to Section I.A.1 of Schedule 2 to the Financing Agreement:“Should there be any activities carried out by any securityunit under the Project, all such activities shall be under the control of the National Department of Health and shall be undertakenexclusively forthe purposes related to the Project. All goods, works, services, Operating Costs, and Training and Workshopsfinanced by the Financing proceeds may be used by the security unit under the direction and control of the National Department ofHealth and strictly in accordance with the Environmental and Social Management Framework and other arrangements or protocols thatthe Association may require for carrying out these activities.”*

Section I.F.2 added to Schedule 2 of the Original Financing Agreement, as incorporated and applied to the Financing Agreementpursuant to Section I.A.1 of Schedule 2 to the Financing Agreement:“Except as the Association may otherwise agree, the Recipientshall ensure that the ownership of any assets generated, goods procured, and works constructed by any security unit out of theFinancing proceeds shall be transferred to, or shall vest, with the National Department of Health or any equivalent or appropriateline ministry or agency agreed with the Association.”*

The Recipient shall establish and maintain, throughout the Project implementation period, a Project Steering Committee, with termsof reference, composition and resources satisfactory to the Association, which shall be responsible for, inter alia, reviewingprogress of Project implementation, ensuring coordinated efforts by all relevant stakeholders and conducting annual reviews of theProject, and composed of members as described in the Project Operations Manual (Section I.A.1 of Schedule 2 to the FinancingAgreement).

The Recipient shall establish and maintain, throughout the Project implementation period, a Project Steering Committee, with termsof reference, composition and resources satisfactory to the Association/Bank, which shall be composed of senior executivemanagementof NDOH and responsible for, inter alia, reviewing progress of Project implementation, ensuring coordinated efforts byall relevant stakeholders and conducting annual reviews of the Project. (Section I.A.1 of Schedule 2 to the Original FinancingAgreement, as incorporated and applied to the Financing Agreement pursuant to Section I.A.1 of Schedule 2 to the FinancingAgreement)**

The Recipient shall prepare and furnish to the Association, by not later than one month after the Effective Date and January 1 andJune 1 of each subsequent year during the implementation of the Project, for the Association/Bank’s review and no-objection, aSemi-Annual Work Plan and Budget for the Project. The Recipient shall ensure that the Project is implemented in accordance with theSemi-Annual Work Plans and Budgets accepted by the Association/Bank for the relevant period covered by the plan. (Section I.C ofSchedule 2 to the Original Financing Agreement, as incorporated and applied to the Financing Agreement pursuant to Section I.A.1 ofSchedule 2 to the Financing Agreement)**

The Recipient shall prepare and furnish to the Association, by not later than one month after the Effective Date and January 1 andJune 1 of each subsequent year during the implementation of the Project, for the Association’s review and no-objection, aSemi-Annual Work Plan and Budget for the Project. The Recipient shall ensure that the Project is implemented in accordance with theSemi-Annual Work Plans and Budgets accepted by the Association for the relevant period covered by the plan. (Sections I.C ofSchedule 2 to the Financing Agreement).

The Recipient shall vest responsibility for the overall management and implementation of the Project in NDOH, and the Recipient,through NDOH, shall ensure that the secretary of NDOH serves as the Project director, who shall be responsible for, inter alia,providing Project oversight and coordinating Project implementation among the relevant divisions and departments of NDOH and theProvincial Health Authorities. (Sections I.A.2 and I.A.3(a) of Schedule 2 to the Financing Agreement).*

The Recipient shall vest responsibility for the overall management and implementation of the Project in NDOH, and the Recipient,through NDOH, shall ensure that the secretary of NDOH serves as the Project director, who shall be responsible for, inter alia,providing Project oversight and coordinating Project implementation among the relevant divisions and departments of NDOH and theProvincial Health Authorities. (Sections I.A.2 and I.A.3(a) of Schedule 2 to the Original Financing Agreement, as incorporated andapplied to the Financing Agreement pursuant to Section I.A.1 of Schedule 2 to the Financing Agreement)**

The Recipient shall, by not later than two months after the Effective Date, prepare and adopt a Project Operations Manual, andthereafter ensure that the Project is carried out in accordance with the Project Operations Manual. (Sections I.B of Schedule 2 tothe Financing Agreement).

The Recipient, through NDOH, shall maintain, throughout the Project implementation period, the Project Coordination Unit, withterms of reference, composition and resources satisfactory to the Association, which shall be: (i) responsible for carrying outday-to-day management and implementation of the Project; and (ii) composed of, at a minimum, a Project coordinator and aprocurement specialist, and, but only from the respective dates referred to in Section I.A.3(c) of Schedule 2 to the FinancingAgreement, an environmental and social specialist, a financial management specialist and a monitoring and evaluation specialist,each with terms of reference, qualifications and experience satisfactory to the Association. (Sections I.A.3(b) of Schedule 2 tothe Financing Agreement).

The Recipient, through NDOH, shall maintain, throughout the Project implementation period, the Project Coordination Unit, withterms of reference, composition and resources satisfactory to the Association/Bank, which shall be: (i) responsible for carryingout day-to-day management and implementation of the Project; and (ii) composed of, at a minimum, a Project coordinator and aprocurement specialist, and, but only from the respective dates referred to in Section I.A.3(c) of Schedule 2 to the OriginalFinancing Agreement, an environmental and social specialist, a financial management specialist and a monitoring and evaluationspecialist, each with terms of reference, qualifications and experience satisfactory to the Association/Bank. (Section I.A.3(b) ofSchedule 2 to the Original Financing Agreement, as incorporated and applied to the Financing Agreement pursuant to Section I.A.1 ofSchedule 2 to the Financing Agreement)**

The Recipient, through NDOH, shall recruit or appoint the following specialists, each with terms of reference, qualifications andexperience satisfactory to the Association, within the Project Coordination Unit: (i) by not later than one month after theEffective Date, an environmental and social specialist; and (ii) by not later than three months after the Effective Date, afinancial management specialist and a monitoring and evaluation specialist. (Sections I.A.3(c) of Schedule 2 to the FinancingAgreement).

The Recipient, through NDOH, shall recruit or appoint the following specialists, each with terms of reference, qualifications andexperience satisfactory to the Association/Bank, within the Project Coordination Unit: (i) by not later than one month after theEffective Date, an environmental and social specialist; and (ii) by not later than three months after the Effective Date, afinancial management specialist and a monitoring and evaluation specialist. (Section I.A.3(c) of Schedule 2 to the OriginalFinancing Agreement, as incorporated and applied to the Financing Agreement pursuant to Section I.A.1 of Schedule 2 to theFinancing Agreement)**

title.narrative: Number of Provincial Hospitals that have a medical waste management plan in line with NDOH protocols (Number)

Proportion of laboratory-confirmed cases of COVID-19 responded to within 48 hours (Male)
Proportion of samples from suspected cases of COVID-19 / SARI that are confirmed within 48 hours
Proportion of samples from suspected cases of COVID-19/SARI of which testing is completed and reported within 48 hours (Male)
Number of provincial hospitals with fully equipped isolation facilities (Number)
Number of Provinces with personal protective equipment (PPE) and infection prevention & control (IPC) products and supplies, without stock-outs in preceding two weeks (Number)
Number of designated laboratories with COVID-19/SARI diagnostic Polymerized Chain Reaction (PCR) and/or GeneXpert capacities established per NDOH guidelines (Number)
Number of media messages disseminated with information on COVID-19 (Number)
Number of community engagement activities implemented
Proportion of laboratory-confirmed cases of COVID-19 responded to within 48 hours (Percentage)

Proportion of samples from suspected cases of COVID-19/SARI of which testing is completed and reported within 48 hours (Female)

Number of health workers participating in COVID-19 related trainings (male)
Number of additional service delivery outreach visits to rural communities conducted in priority provinces
Number of provincial hospitals with oxygen concentrators to manage COVID-19 patients
Percentage increase in the number of pregnant women in rural areas who have received four or more antenatal care check-ups
Percentage of population vaccinated which is included in the priority population targets defined in national plan
Number of Provinces with Provincial Surveillance Officers to support Provincial Command Centers
Number of laboratory technician coaching and training sessions conducted
Number of health workers participating in COVID-19 related trainings
Complaints to the Grievance Redress Mechanism (GRM) satisfactorily addressed within the specified timeframe of initial complaint being received
